Reviews.Title: “The staff deserve an award!”
Reviews.Author: paull25
Reviews.Content: After an awful stay at the Hilton Boston Downtown I decided (depsite my HHonours status) that i wanted a change from the Hilton and used the Marriott for my recent visit to Dallas. The rooms are standard Marriott rooms, clean, comfortable and spacious! What makes this hotel are the staff! They are so friendly, they obviously care for the customers and are proud to work for Marriott. Based on this stay i will probably switch my loyality from Hilton to Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but dont get packages sent here”
Reviews.Author: misstravel56
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at Marriott's in cities all over the USA and have no complaints about the service, or the rooms. I enjoy staying here, however just a word of warning. If you are having a package delivered to the hotel, as I had made an online purchase which arrived at the hotel a couple of hours prior to my checking in, the hotel did not inform me that they would be adding additional charges to my bill, even though I had phoned them in advance letting them know and when being handed over the package the staff said nothing. I did not appreciate the staff not informing me in advance when they had 2 oppourtunities to and they would not remove the charges, even though they only had it for a couple of hours. This is the first time I've ever had this extra charge at any Marriott and I often send packages to hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK full-service Marriott property for the price”
Reviews.Author: tamac9601
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on business based on the price. Great staff, nice gym, nice concierge lounge. Good area for restaurants. The rooms are really showing age and need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Addison Marriott Quorum”
Reviews.Author: Richgray68
Reviews.Content: No complaints. I have stayed in a lot of Marriotts and I have my favorites. From the time I checked in to the time I checked out I was very much satisfied with the service. One negative, the lounge needs to open at 6:30 AM as advertised. It was late opening every day I was there. If you are into working out, the gym is nicer than many Marriotts and is the reason that I am staying there next week. I can't comment on the restaurant. I didn't have an opportunity to eat at the restaurant but it appeared to always be busy.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable value”
Reviews.Author: tdennehy
Reviews.Content: Here for a full work week for company meetings. Nice room, very nice food, pleasant staff. The major negative is something that I have found myself feeling at Marriott Hotels more frequently in recent years--poor value. Corporate rate of $159.00 in DFW in the dead of winter? And then they pinch you hard for everything else you need. WiFi in rooom is $13.00/day. OK, way too much but I have to have it. Guess what? It does not work in the meeting rooms. To get WiFi in the meeting room your company must pay $400 for set up and then $13.00/day/connection. Just don't feel good about it when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Cowboyinthejungle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovation in the public areas, and that is fine, but don't let other things slack off during that time. I had no soap or shampoo in my room when I arrived. I did have Corona beer caps left for me. I did get shampoo and soap the second night of my stay and the housekeepers did leave the bottle caps. Strange, but the wind was blowing quite hard and the three flags right outside my window sounded like fireworks. Even when I turned on my white noise app, it still kept me up. Room service was good, but trays stayed out in the hall for too long. Not the worst stay, but definitely not the best stay. AND who in this day and age still charges for internet access??? Oh, Marriott. Really now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent workout facility and food”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: I was recently here for a training. The Marriott Quorum had the best "seminar" food that I've ever had--breakfast and lunch were excellent. The hotel also has one of the best exercise facilities of any hotel I've been in thus far (I'm 45); it wasn't just an afterthought of a room with a treadmill thrown in for good measure. As far as sleep, the first night was a bit loud--I stayed on the side facing the North Dallas Tollway. The location is otherwise very convenient--walking distance from Beltline and many restaurants in Addison.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay despite property undergoing rennovation”
Reviews.Author: elena c
Reviews.Content: Our family spent one night at the Marriott Quorum - overall the stay was ok. There is construction and the lobby is completely out of commission - leaving guests to search for a place to check in. In the morning - we navigated around construction personnel. Despite the upheaval - we enjoyed our stay and the staff was pleasant and helpful. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was delicious. ElenaC

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room!”
Reviews.Author: finegirl1974
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get a corner room so the room was huge. Very comfortable bed, clean and had all the amenities I one would ever need. Staff was courteous. Don't bother valeting as the valet staff was slow and the self parking was more convenient. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Great restaurants and shopping near by too!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected construction noise spoils stay”
Reviews.Author: karolinakev
Reviews.Content: The website noted that the hotel's lobby was being renovated. But there was no mention that Noise could be heard even on the ninth floor. Hotel staff couldn't believe that the noise was intrusive until I recorded it on my phone. Stay away until construction is complete or you'll have phone calls and sleep interrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of your belongings”
Reviews.Author: Haribommakanti
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriot Quorum on my trip to Dallas. Marriot is one of the preferred Hotel for my employees and i can only say unfortunately. I happened to leave my wallet in my room one day and returned to find around 150$ cash missing, everything else were in place luckily. I immediately alerted the front desk about it and was directed to a loss prevention officer who took my details. I later flew out from Dallas with an assurance that someone from the claims department will get in touch with me shortly. After waiting for 2 days, i had to call them to follow up. Later in the day i received a call from their claims department that they checked with thier housekeeping department and found no cash( Ridiculous!! how can someone find cash when it is stolen!!) and hence nothing they could do about it. While i understand trusting the employees, it is equally important to trust your customers too. I was told i will be sent a 100$ gift card, which i could care for less. I dont need any gift cards, i need this to be addressed and give me my hard earned money back as simple as that. I would not have cared much had the claims department did not sound as if i was reporting a fake claim..all for 150$ when the bill i payed was close to 800. Please beware of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Renovations Looking Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: The room renovations at this Marriott property not far from the Galleria are looking good. For Thanksgiving weekend, we got a nice upgraded room -- quite large -- for an incredible $87 per night. The only spoiler is that self-parking costs $12 per night. Service was quite good, considering the holiday and we could easily access outstanding shopping in just minutes. The rooms were clean, new HDTVs installed, and beds are comfortable. For the rate we paid, it was a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Freaking disgusting”
Reviews.Author: adrake6
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival our keys didn't work to get to the self parking which on book it it says free parking but in actuality its 12 a night. Room is spacious and nice but our night which I remind you its cold in Dallas we had no hot water so we had to take cold showers. Secondly we found make up on one of the pillow cases. The next day I called "at your service" which is there logo. For them to come change our sheets and bring us extra towels while we were out, we return to hotel at 9 pm and nothing was done. So I calls for extra sheets so I can change the bedding myself and there was blood on the mattress itself. FREAKING DISGUSTING! AVOID AT ALL COST! I STAYED IN NOVEMBER '11

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: soonerbeachguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Addison Marriott because of how close it was to the Galleria mall. Brought our 5 year daughter down to visit the American Doll Store. We only stayed one night but we had a great time. The pool area was nice with pool that started indoors and connected to the outside area. My daughter enjoyed being able to swim under the window and be outside. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. Would have preferred better pillows, but I could say the same about the ones I have at home. There were also more than 50 recognizable restaurants within just a few minutes of the hotel. I did enjoy the covered parking although I would prefer not to have to pay to park. Overall I stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A good business and family destination”
Reviews.Author: PKOR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Addison Marriott 3 nights this week. Although this is a rather common hotel by the American standards, I was pleasantly surprised: very helpful staff all around (reception desk, bellboys, room cleaning...), nice and clean rooms, spacious gym open all night and nice indoor and outdoor pool for families. Plus shuttle service to the convenient Galleria Mall nearby and taxi limousine service to and from the Airport at a reasonable price. Definitely a good destination. Have not tried the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay near the Galleria Mall”
Reviews.Author: rhkfreespirit
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not connected to the mall itself, it is about a 10 minute ride away. I stayed here two nights for business on the Concierge level which has been recently renovated quite nicely....very clean, updated and comfortable room. The hotel has pictures in the lobby showing that it is in the process of being renovated so that I assume the rest of the property will have the same feel soon. Restaurant food was actually much better than the dining area which is a glorified bar room.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: snoto63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last March for a dental meeting. This hotel has really good restaurants and is connected to the Galleria for lots of shopping! We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Functional business hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueIslander
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights in September 2011. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and the rooms were a reasonable size. Wireless internet throughout the hotel worked pretty well and the gym was generally a bit better than expected. The free shuttle service to local offices and malls was punctual and flexible and there are a few reasonable eating options nearby, which is just as well because the bar food wasn't great. The hotel was pretty clean and tidy, though the pool area could do with a good scrub. the hotel is right next to a major highway too - so don't expect too much peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT meeting venue!”
Reviews.Author: kmurtz
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a few days at this hotel and was blown away by the hospitality shown to me and my coworkers. We were there for meetings which required a meeting facility and food. The hotel manager, Andrew, was incredibly hospitable and helpful and had arranged for Emilio, his Banquet manager to set us up with breakfast food for our attendees. The food was outstanding on both the days that we required their services. Both Drew and Emilio stuck around to make certain that everything was to our satisfaction and specifications. The room itself was ideal for our needs. I also stayed at the hotel for these two nights and found it to be very comfortable and welcoming. The staff was well-trained and polite. I spent some time in the Concierge Lounge and was equally impressed with the staff there. Overall, it is very evident that Andrew has done an exceptional job training his staff. Kudos to all of you at this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel, and we will return.”
Reviews.Author: evenpargolf
Reviews.Content: Great location in North Dallas. Near very good restaurants. Hotel location has easy access to North Dallas Tollway. Friendly and helpfull staff. Clean, quiet big rooms. Have stayed here before and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere - There are better options.”
Reviews.Author: beantownmba
Reviews.Content: First: my overwhelming complaint. My room appears to be *ON* the highway. The highway literally curves around the hotel; and Dallas traffic is heavy and constant. I'm a heavy sleeper, and it even bothered me. Secondly, the toilet seat. I grew up in a household of women; I've learned to always lift the seat. So, when It won't stay up, I'm like a lost puppy. Do I sit? No, that's not an option. Do I hold the seat up? It seems I'm losing my focus on the matter at hand... I'd better just find another bathroom... Third, cleanliness. Room flyers say sheets are to be replaced every third night, to conserve. I can appreciate that. But... I was disappointed when, on my third night, I came home to the same sheets on my bed. $12/night for parking. It appears to be free everywhere else in the area. This is unreasonable. Wired internet in the rooms (for a fee, free for elite); this is the norm, but could stand to be upgraded to wireless. The elevators were surprisingly busy for a 12 story building, taking several minutes and getting overcrowded on 2-3 occasions, most often in the morning. The staff was always courteous and helpful. For elite members, the concierge lounge is nice - a little larger than average, and the one night I went up, pulled pork sandwiches were above average. I was here for a conference at the Sheraton Dallas North Hotel (http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g55711-d98639-Reviews-Sheraton_Dallas_North_Hotel-Dallas_Texas.html) and conference mates who stayed there appeared to be much more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: pkbroch
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel across the parkway from many interesting restaurants. The rooms are average Marriott, they are clean and the beds comfortable. Many towels in the bathroom and very good lighting in all rooms. Hilton take note. Lobby is large with ample seating in groupings, very good for our family special occasion. The cafe has a good breakfast and a nice brunch. The bar has decent service. Pool and sauna area is unique with lots of chairs and towels. Both indoor and outdoor pool sections, fitness room overlooks the pool area. Very nicely laid out. Starbucks in lobby and very nice staff. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: great hotel if you can take advantage of the shuttle. hotel is average for a marriott, but area dinning opitons make up for lack of character. Make sure you hit trulucks/kennny's woodfired grill on your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwrileyi
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded at this hotel and had a really nice room. Staff were really helpful and the shuttle bus was great - meant we did not have to use the car. The use of the guest laundry was free including the powder - helpful when you have been travelling for some time.

Reviews.Title: “A/C not good”
Reviews.Author: shegeek_tulsa
Reviews.Content: Sadly I've stayed at this hotel for years, and it's had it's ups and downs. But this year it has been really down. The A/C on the concierge floor wasn't even working in the hall ways. In the rooms you can set it on 65 degrees and it might get down to 78 degrees at best.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott, but beware the highway noise”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel recently. The hotel is an average Marriott, with a soft bed, average-sized room, decent fitness and indoor/outdoor pool, and friendly front-desk staff. The internet was included with my business rate, but based on the prices others were quoting on Tripadvisor, my mid-week $149 fee was too high. However, the hotel is right next to the Dallas Parkway (good for getting on the freeway, but bad for noise at night). I heard the flow of cars the entire time I was awake in my room. I sleep somewhat heavy, so once asleep I did not notice it. The hotel is at least 20 minutes from downtown. Also, even though the hotel is fairly isolated (in an area with tons of parking), they still charge $12 (or something like that) to park overnight. They also have valet covering the entire front lot that could easily be used for all of the guests. The entire valet section had many 7 cars in it. This is just an unfortunate way to make extra money - Marriott should just raise the rates by $10, because every single guest would have to park in the garage (how else would you get to this hotel)?

Reviews.Title: “Good as you expect...not earth-shattering”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is good. Above average. I can't complain. They did a few things above and beynd the expectation. Room was clean,,,beds were soft. Place was acceptable...not worh writing home about. I enjoyed it.. Worht the weekend rate of $69 a night for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kadelia
Reviews.Content: Held a business meeting there and stayed overnight; was extremely impressed by the bedding-like laying on a cloud! Easy to find location right off the Dallas tollway-dismayed by the expensive parking ($8 for 2 -6 hours...not nice for meeting guests only) but very sleek and pretty hotel. Room was standard size, nicely appointed with a fridge and extra large flat screen TV. Shower water pressure was adequate. Very easy checkin and painless check out. Held a dinner meeting in the restaurant-very attentive staff (although slow to serve) and food was really, really good. Some said outstanding-and we had everything from the fish, to the filet mignon to the chicken. Drinks were somewhat watered down, though. Would definitely return to for business stay - was very convenient to the many restaurants in Addison and shopping at the Galleria is always a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Upper End Hotel near shopping mall”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaSteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mariott Quorum with my parents and now take my family. It has been remodled and well maintained. If you are there Sunday morning, be sure and eat breakfast in the hotel. A fabulous buffet and a chef to prepare omelets. Will always return.

Reviews.Title: “functional hotel but far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: grey2009
Reviews.Content: must stay close to work - so suited that requirement. though a little far from down town rooms are good. lobby/coffee shop average. staff is friendly has laundromat

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: sdufdl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, and found the experience very enjoyable. The staff was very friendly. The hotel was very clean. The workout facility was very good. Late checkout is standard. The restaurant was only average. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: sjd74
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in October 2008. The hotel itself is in an excellent location in Addison. Although we were on the Concierge Level, the rooms were well equipped and the pubic areas were well furnished. The pool was good, although probably needs checking every day for leaves etc. Three downsides - the breakfast room, bar prices and internet access. For a 500+ room hotel to have such a poorly equipped (and sized) restaurant means a disaster on Sunday mornings - so get there early to avoid the queues. I bought a pint and a Baileys one evening in the bar - and it cost $14.50 !!! With so many alternatives for bars in the vicinty, on Beltline Road, those prices are stupid. Finally, the internet access. Despite advertising that wireless access was free in the lobby, what it actually means is they provide 3 terminals in a business centre for anytime usage. If you want to use your own PC, you'll have to pay stupid prices. That said, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the surrounding restaurants are fantastic (especially On The Border), and in response to a previous comment, it is easy to avoid toll roads - we drove round every day without going near a toll booth.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: penguin78law
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bad location for business travelers- far from downtown - if you want to be near the mall. It is on a toll road so every time you leave the property you must pay the tolls- a very annoying 55 cents/ 40 cents. The room was ok the evelvators where horrible and the parking cost $10.00 an annoying expense for Dallas where most hotel parking is free. There are better marriotts and hotels in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “great mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: alaska777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marriott off the tollway on august 30-sep1-2008. We had a great time. This was a gift from friends for us so this was special. I loved the free shuttle service. I thought the hours were resonable, after all you did not have to burn your own gas, pay for a cab, or lose your parking space and that I'm picky about. so we went to the galleria and into a 3 story macy's well, the mall was 3 storys. had excellent service there and to truluks steak and seafood on beltline road. I've been there before, but I promise if you go, you never want to go to red lobster again. It is worth the money but it is pricey for most people.I felt this hotel was a little overpriced since it did not have microwaves and refrigerators in the room but found out you can ask for one I don't know if you have to pay extra or not. We tipped everyone who waited on us so expect to bring a wad of money thats how good they are and friendly. We had pizza in the room one night and it was good and the free breakfast was great they made fresh omeletts and waffles at your request. We did not use the pool but it looked nice I thought it would have been to cold but the outside is heated. I liked the little gift shop I found a nice thank-you card there.Not many channels to watch on t.v., but who is here to watch t.v.? The big beds were soft and so were the pillows.our room was a little stale at first, but they fixed that and we had a little misunderstanding with the check-in people about there polices but they sent a bottle of wine and a gift basket up to the room soon after, which was nice of them. There were a few things that could have been better. I think the parking was to expensive. Also don't stay on the window side of the tollway next to the toll booth, it will keep you up all night cars racing all night long, very irritating. And it was to late to move to another room. this was after midnight and lasted until around 5:30 in the morning.The room card also did not work. they were touchy you had to try several times and get it just right or you were not getting into your room.overall It was nice since it was free, but I probably would not stay there again since they have courtyard marriotts all over the place that are just as nice and once you've stayed at the grand hyatt at the airport or Somewhere in Las Vegas you won't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: n6877
Reviews.Content: pretty good hotel an good location put some family up when they came to visit they did not spend alot of time at the hotel but it was clean and service was good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: AZ2323
Reviews.Content: We are from Phoenix and spent two nights here because my son han a gymnastics meet. The three people we came in contact with at the front desk were awesome. I asked for an upgrade to the concierge floor and they were happy to do it for me. The hotel is located next to the north toll way and has about 40 restaurants within a mile. They have a very nice workout center next to the indoor/outdoor pool with a large jacuzzi. We paid the extra $20/day for the breakfast buffet for up to two adults and two kids which was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: artfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for a week in September. The hotel is in Addison and is walking distance to some nice restaurants. The only thing is that the streets are a little difficult to navigate in. The hotel staff was nice. Didn't have too many interaction with them. Nothing really jumped out at me with this hotel. The room was nice. The only thing that stood out was the $9.95 internet access. This was per day. That was a bit high. The room was okay. The bathroom could use a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms but Poor Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: HappytoGo
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights while attending a conference in the hotel. The room was great and the staff was enjoyable. The conference rooms were great and the breakfast at the restaurant was above average. My only complaint would be that they need to be more lenient on the shuttle service. There were 300+ people in town for a convention and they would only do a drop off/pick up at the Galleria every hour. It wasnâ€™t that far but if you showed up at 10 past the hour you had to wait the 50 minutes or pay for a taxi. And the shuttle and the driver would just sit there as well.

Reviews.Title: “its ok.”
Reviews.Author: cooper12
Reviews.Content: stay friday thur sun. This hotel is centrally located to the galleria area. the rooms are ok. we did have problem with hair left in the shower. it was fixed soon after we reported it. Parking is a rip. If you go out at night forget about getting a free spot in front of the hotel. it is an extra ten dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “They consider this luxury?”
Reviews.Author: alisa110
Reviews.Content: My husband was in charge of choosing the hotel this time and for the last time. We stayed here for Christmas to attend the Cowboy football game with my Family on Christmas Day, and do some after Christmas shopping. I was very disappointed. The hotel room had an old stale smell, it wasn't very clean and the food was terrible. I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: Talk about luxury and convenience, this is the place to stay. I got a weekend rate and had a nice large corner room with a comfy bed. Free shuttle to and from Airport and staff was very friendly. Strongly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved me when I was stranded”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: On a night when over 200 flights out of Dallas were cancelled and the highways were fender-deep in water, I stayed at this Marriott because it was the closest place to the airport that had room as the hotels filled up. A couple of features set this hotel above its competition as a business hotel. First, the mattress is the best I've slept on - better than a Heavenly Bed, better than a Ritz. And not just because it beat sleeping on the floor of the airport like 3,000 of my fellow travelers! Second, the hotel actually acknowledges that you need to do work and so has a great electronics console as a sort of backsplash to the desk - lots of outlets, phone lines, and other plug-ins for all your gizmos so that you don't have to move appliances or crawl around on the floor. Finally, instead of a $5.00 cheapo clock alarm or one of those new weird pre-programmed radios (I hate those things), this clock radio had an iPod docking station attached to it. The room also had a flat-screen TV and wonderful uni-sex orange-scented amenities. And the nice man at the desk gave me a free toothbrush so I wouldn't have socks on my teeth the next morning when I got up to schlep back to the airport. And a free bottle of water, not one that cost $6.00 like the hotel I stayed in the night before. Also - compact flourescents in the guest rooms! Thanks for saving energy, and for keeping the bathroom light fixtures from melting a gal's makeup (even if it was day-old makeup). I only wish you would have had recycling in the guest room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: julesism
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding for my two night stay in Dallas. I was there for R&R, to visit a friend, to shop, and enjoy the nice weather. I had requested an early check-in which they were able to accomadate, and it was great to be in my room and taking a nap by 12 noon. The room was very nice, decent sized., nice chair in the corner, and the bed was marvelous. Duvet comforter and lots of pillows. Pillow top mattresses. Bathroom was very clean with nice granite top vanity. Good water pressure in the shower. The hotel has a nifty shuttle to the galleria mall. The mall is beautiful and I enjoyed shopping there. I also sat by the pool, on the sunny day and that was very nice. Room service was good and the pizza I ordered and the burger were quite good. This is a great hotel for $239 a night, which is what I paid. There also is a gift shop with a Starbucks attached. Good selection of magazines there. Nice large workout room near the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky you if your conference is here”
Reviews.Author: wnissen
Reviews.Content: Despite some minor maintenance issues (broken outlet, leak in shower), the room quality and service here is superior. Even the food in the restaurant is well above average (try the short ribs), if not exactly cheap. The room is, as usual for Marriotts, well-appointed, and at very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dpbillsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Quorum Feb 15th-19th. Very nice hotel. The room we stayed in was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Took the free shuttle over to the Galleria which was nice. All around great hotel and can't wait to go back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: spbennet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your typical Marriott and what I mean by that it is a really nice hotel but nothing exciting. When you arrive make sure and valet the first night if you have allot of bags. The parking garage is convenient but the elevator is always broken and you will have to go up stairs if it is broken. The check in staff is always friendly and check you in very promptly, They they have recently done renovations and if you get one of the new rooms they are very nice. If you want a room with some extra space ask for a corner room. If you are traveling on business they have a real nice work area and the TV is very nice. The food at the restaurant is very good especially if you like Steak. The bar is huge but the bartenders could be a little better and more observant. The breakfast buffet is pretty big with a wide selection so if you are looking to start your day off right I recommend it. The hotel is in an area with a bunch of shopping and restaurants so you need to check out the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Algood
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Stayed here after the renovations. The room was not big in size but the beds and pillows were wonderful. The flat panel TV is a nice touch. The staff was very friendly. They have a kiosk where you can print out boarding passes which is a blessing. There are tons of restaurants around this hotel and the variety of it is great. Wish they offered wireless since now even the motels are offering them for free !! Great location Great Staff. Definitely will stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Dallas Addison Marriott Quorum By the Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 14901 Dallas Parkway, Dallas, TX 14901
